description.raw:
`MzML._determine_array_dtype` currently assumes that the array is either a 32-bit float or a 64-bit float, and treats anything else as a 64-bit float. This PR makes `MzML._determine_array_dtype` aware of the other three data types, integers and null-terminated strings.

Charge arrays are required to be 32-bit integers. I’ve never seen 64-bit integer or null-terminated strings, but they’re in the spec for non-standard array types.
description.html:
MzML._determine_array_dtype currently assumes that the array is either a 32-bit float or a 64-bit float, and treats anything else as a 64-bit float. This PR makes MzML._determine_array_dtype aware of the other three data types, integers and null-terminated strings.

Charge arrays are required to be 32-bit integers. I’ve never seen 64-bit integer or null-terminated strings, but they’re in the spec for non-standard array types.

title.raw: Update MzML._determine_array_dtype to handle the full set of "binary data type" terms
title.html: Update MzML._determine_array_dtype to handle the full set of "binary data type" terms
